summary: The concept of "videotape library," now redirected to the preferred term "video library," pertains to the categorization of audiovisual documentation within EU legal and regulatory frameworks. A video library serves as a repository for video materials, which may include educational, informational, or regulatory content relevant to EU legislation and policy. Such libraries facilitate access to visual documentation, enhancing transparency and knowledge dissemination among stakeholders. In the context of EU regulations, video libraries can support compliance and training initiatives, ensuring that relevant parties are informed about legal obligations and best practices through accessible audiovisual resources.
